body:
Python2 to Python3 Supports by handling,
step 1: 2to3 -w files
step 2: manually modifications involving subprocess.Popen.communicate on unicode transferring from binary to unicode strings, stdout, stdin, stderr and so on

Hi Simon, 

Can you open a JIRA and attach a patch here https://issues.apache.org/jira/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20AMBARI
That's the current workflow for getting patches committed.
Moved patch to [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-6903).

Hi @saurabhjain1537 , I don't know if the community looks into github's PRs actively.
They have a document how to contribute here https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

Hi @wdavidw.
Thanks for your contribution.
This is Apache Ambari's read-only mirror and we don't handle Github PR for committing.
Please open a JIRA and attach your patch so that it can go through the standard dev process for Apache Ambari: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute
Ok, I'll do that but I suffer from JIRA headache : )

Hi , thank you for the contribution. According to our dev process, please submit a patch and code review to the Jira. https://docs.google.com/a/hortonworks.com/document/d/1hz7qjGKkNeckMibEs67ZmAa2kxjie0zkG6H_IiC2RgA
Hi Vito, thank you for your contribution. Ambari uses Jira, patches, and reviews.apache.org to checkin code, please see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

Thank you for your contribution.  We can't work with pull requests, unfortunately.
Please create a JIRA and submit a patch here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20AMBARI

HI Rahul, for Ambari, we commit changes by creating a Jira and attaching the patch as a code review.
You can follow this guide, https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Commit
Thank you for contributing.

Hi Andrew, thank you for your contribution. For Ambari development, we use patches and attach them to the Jira, and generate a code review at https://reviews.apache.org

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute
Thanks, have done.

Hi,

Thank you for your contribution. Our dev process is to use patches and code reviews instead of pull requests. 
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

Cheers,
Alejandro

Hi, thank you for your interest in submitting your contribution. Please take a look at our dev process since we use Jiras and https://reviews.apache.org

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

Regarding your patch, it would work for Linux but not Windows.

Cheers,
Alejandro
Hi DonMaja, thank you for you contribution. Please take a look at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

Hi huhue, we typically accept patches on the Apache Jira website along with a code review.
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

Thanks,
Alejandro

Hi afernandez, 
I readed the wiki, and push a merge request in jira three days ago, but I do not get response about this. 
I have something strange about these. 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-16733 
can you help me?
+tbeerbower for reviewing the change in his part of the code.

Hi vsivaguru, thank you for your contribution. Please refer to https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

-Alejandro
JIRA number would be updated in PR once it is filed by @raghavgautam
Hi @satishd, Ambari doesn't use pull request on Github. Please refer to https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute
@HeartSaVioR got to know that. Raised review request as suggested by @harshach

Hi, thank you for your contribution, please see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute
on how to create patches for an Apache Jira.

Ambari uses JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ambari/ for issue tracking and review board for reviews: https://reviews.apache.org/

Please log a issue on the JIRA, and submit a patch for review.

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute
Thanks.  This is fixed in 57037fe.
Thanks. This is fixed in 57037fe.

Please ping after you merge them. I can help review that.

Nice

@gautamborad Could you please review and merge the PR?
the base branch is now old but the same property value still exist in trunk branch.

Hi, please see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute on how to contribute a patch.
Basically, create a Jira on Apache, upload your patch, and create a code review.
This literally bothered me for several days!

hello, Install Ambari 2.5 install HDP 2.6 , spark_client install error "parent directory /usr/hdp/current/spark-client/conf doesn't exist", copy other node `/etc/spark` to current node solve the problem。

Detail Errors
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/lib/ambari-agent/cache/common-services/SPARK/1.2.1/package/scripts/spark_client.py", line 88, in <module>
    SparkClient().execute()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/libraries/script/script.py", line 314, in execute
    method(env)
  File "/var/lib/ambari-agent/cache/common-services/SPARK/1.2.1/package/scripts/spark_client.py", line 38, in install
    self.configure(env)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/libraries/script/script.py", line 117, in locking_configure
    original_configure(obj, *args, **kw)
  File "/var/lib/ambari-agent/cache/common-services/SPARK/1.2.1/package/scripts/spark_client.py", line 49, in configure
    setup_spark(env, 'client', upgrade_type=upgrade_type, action='config', config_dir=config_dir)
  File "/var/lib/ambari-agent/cache/common-services/SPARK/1.2.1/package/scripts/setup_spark.py", line 67, in setup_spark
    mode=0644
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/base.py", line 155, in __init__
    self.env.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/environment.py", line 160, in run
    self.run_action(resource, action)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/environment.py", line 124, in run_action
    provider_action()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/libraries/providers/properties_file.py", line 54, in action_create
    mode = self.resource.mode
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/base.py", line 155, in __init__
    self.env.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/environment.py", line 160, in run
    self.run_action(resource, action)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/environment.py", line 124, in run_action
    provider_action()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/resource_management/core/providers/system.py", line 120, in action_create
    raise Fail("Applying %s failed, parent directory %s doesn't exist" % (self.resource, dirname))
resource_management.core.exceptions.Fail: Applying File['/usr/hdp/current/spark-client/conf/spark-defaults.conf'] failed, parent directory /usr/hdp/current/spark-client/conf doesn't exist
```

Feel free to create a Jira, patch, and contact me (alejandro@apache.org) so I can merge your patch.
Thank you

One thing that bothers me is that this seems to only work with secure ports below 1024 - I think it should work on all ports. Checking with HDFS to see what the deal is there ...
LGTM

Jenkins here runs tests on trunk for some reason not branch-3.0-perf.
Which doesn't even have the changes, ignoring it.
Actually it gave me jenkins link for previous pull request. But anyway currently we have tests broken on feature branch. So failing jenkins is expected.

@seanorama Please read the How to contribute guide and follow pull request guidelines-
 https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute

@swagle @mpapirkovskyy Now that build goes beyond `ambari-utility`, the size of the [build log](https://builds.apache.org/job/Ambari-Github-PullRequest-Builder/10/console) produced is ~220MB.  It seems `ActiveWidgetLayoutResourceProviderTest` is responsible for 182MB of that due to `StackOverflowError` in `createInjector()`.  I have added another commit to disable that test until the error can be investigated.

Earlier Jenkins job used to fail for **Ambari Web**  and **Ambari Metrics Storm Sink** project on ambari branch-2.6
After the patch Jenkins Job fails only on **Ambari Web** project

@atkach  @aleksandrkovalenko Please help me review it, 
The Jira details are here : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-22625

@adoroszlai, please don't focus on trying to fix unit tests here. 
In current version more than 400 are failing or behaving incorrectly.
I'm currently working on fixing them in separate patch. 
Additional changes may cause unnecessary merge conflicts.
@mpapirkovskyy I do not intend to fix any more unit tests on `branch-3.0-perf`, just was curious why `ambari-utility` was failing.
Sorry for the late response, it was fixed in 4c0cb055903.

Adding @rlevas and @echekanskiy, Please review the proposed changes in this patch.

Copying description as present on Apache Jira:

> Ambari agents running in Docker containers frequently have /tmp and /etc mountpoints. Between HDFS, ZooKeeper, HBase, and YARN configs, it's very easy to mistakenly accept a /tmp/hadoop suggested data directory. Any mountpoints with /tmp or /etc should be omitted.
test message, ignore

@randerzander This patch completely masks the information of /etc and /tmp being mountpoints on hosts.

IMO even if /etc and /tmp are mountpoints on the hosts then the host API should keep showing that correct information but we can change the logic that recommends data directory for hadoop services to exclude /etc and /tmp mountpoints
Additionally if some user changes the recommended value to include /etc and /tmp mountpoints for data directories, we can validate and warn end user about it.

cc @u39kun
+1 LGTM

@GrigorievNick Please report this issue on Apache Ambari Jira. Each PR should be associated with Apache Ambari Jira.

I have added @aonishuk @dlysnichenko as reviewers. Please look into the changes proposed in this patch when you get chance.
@GrigorievNick Lets create Apache jira as mentioned in PR #41 and merge this work to a single revised PR in PR#41 itself

I am able to compile ambari-metrics trunk bits on my machine
@swagle @avijayanhwx any idea of this being an issue in the past ?

@sumitmohanty Ambari project has now migrated to GitHub pull request process. The one that you were exploring with this patch 😄 
Please let us know if you intend to resubmit the revised PR or else you can remove yourself as assignee from [AMBARI-19412](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-19412) and we can drop this PR. Some other dev can own and submit new PR for [AMBARI-19412](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-19412)

Going forward to retrigger Jenkins build we need to just comment "@asfbot retest"

Let's commit this patch for now and keep an eye on another build for branch-2.6
